p: The ethanolic extract of C. sinaica was evaluated in streptozocin diabetic rabbits. The blood glucose-lowering effect of alcoholic extract 100 mg/kg was more pronounced in diabetic animals than in the glibenclamide-treated group. In addition, it had the capacity to prevent an increase in hyperglycemia after oral glucose load [ 33]. As the dose increased from 150 to 200 mg/kg, there were no toxic or behavioral changes observed in the animals [ 33].
